title: Saturation Numbers for Linear Forests $P_7+tP_2$
authors: Yu Zhang and Rong-Xia Hao and Zhen He and Wen-Han Zhu
abstract:
Let $H$ be a fixed graph, a graph G is $H$-saturated if it has no copy of $H$
in $G$, but the addition of any edge in $E(\overline G)$ to $G$ results in an
$H$-subgraph. The saturation number sat$(n,H)$ is the minimum number of edges
in an $H$-saturated graph on $n$ vertices. In this paper, we determine the
saturation number sat$(n,P_7+tP_2)$ for $n\geq \frac {14}{5}t+27$ and
characterize the extremal graphs for $n\geq \frac{14}{13}(3t+25)$.
